com.uce.userlab.haptics.event
Interface HapticListener

public interface HapticListener

This interface lays out the methods that a haptic Device listener must have to listen to any haptic Device, there are methods for regualar update calls updates, inputs and event interal errors so that a listener is always kept informed about the state inwhich the haptic Device is in.

Method Summary
 void deviceCallback(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired at a regular intervile to ask for updates from the listeners
 void deviceInput(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired when an input has been made on the device or its state has been changed by the user
 void deviceManagementError(HapticEvent event, DeviceException exc)
          This methods is fired when an internal error occures, usualy within a device management loop
 void deviceUpdate(HapticEvent event)
          This methods is fired when an update has been made to the device
 

Method Detail

deviceCallback

void deviceCallback(HapticEvent event)
This methods is fired at a regular intervile to ask for updates from the listeners

Parameters:
event - The HapticEvent object that describes the event and the situation at the time of the event fire

deviceUpdate

void deviceUpdate(HapticEvent event)
This methods is fired when an update has been made to the device

Parameters:
event - The HapticEvent object that describes the event and the situation at the time of the event fire

deviceInput

void deviceInput(HapticEvent event)
This methods is fired when an input has been made on the device or its state has been changed by the user

Parameters:
event - The HapticEvent object that describes the event and the situation at the time of the event fire

deviceManagementError

void deviceManagementError(HapticEvent event,
                           DeviceException exc)
This methods is fired when an internal error occures, usualy within a device management loop

Parameters:
event - The HapticEvent object that describes the event and the situation at the time of the event fire
exc - The DeviceException describing the error that occured internaly
